alert.note: Alert for Lower Clark Fork Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 29 at 12:45PM MST until December 03 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow above 4000 feet in Montana, and above 3000 feet in Idaho, with snow amounts of 10 to 20 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph. For lower elevations, snow amounts of 2 to 5 inches possible through Sunday morning with a mix of rain/snow/freezing rain possible Sunday afternoon and evening. * WHERE...Evaro Hill, I-90 Lookout Pass to Haugan, Pierce, Highway 11 Pierce to Headquarters, Elk River, Highway 200 Thompson Falls to Plains, and Highway 200 Trout Creek to Heron * WHEN...From Friday afternoon through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact commuters.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
